## 판결문 요약

471 F.2d 495
    UNITED STATES of America, Plaintiff-Appellee,v.Alexander GAUS, Jr., Defendant-Appellant.
    No. 71-1885.
    United States Court of Appeals,Seventh Circuit.
    Argued Sept. 21, 1972.Decided Jan. 10, 1973.Rehearing Denied Jan. 26, 1973.
    
      Anna R. Lavin, Chicago, Ill., for defendant-appellant.
      John O. Olson, U. S. Atty., Madison, Wis., for plaintiff-appellee.
      Before KILEY and STEVENS, Circuit Judges, and CAMPBELL, Senior District Judge.1
      KILEY, Circuit Judge.
    
    
      1
      Defendant Gaus has appealed from his conviction under an indictment charging in Counts I and II, respectively, the transportation or causing the transportation of a $6,000 check, and the transportation of a $5,000 check, from Wisconsin to Illinois, knowing the checks were converted or taken by fraud, in violation of 18 U.S.C. Sec. 2314.  We affirm.
    
    
      2
      In the spring of 1967 Gaus was invited by the Board of Directors of the Cedar Crest Retirement Home, a not-for-profit corporation in Janesville, Wisconsin,2 to a meeting at Cedar Crest.  Gaus attended the meeting and persuaded the Board of Directors that he could secure a loan for construction of a nursing home under consideration.  Gaus requested, as an advance for his expenses in securing a construction loan of $1,200,000 for Cedar Crest, the $6,000 check subject of Count I. He told Cedar Crest officials that the $6,000 would be returned to them as part of the loan he was to secure.  ...
